newsitem.title: ITALY: Present form of Italy's IRI makes no sense - Treu.
newsitem.headline: Present form of Italy's IRI makes no sense - Treu.

text.p: The current form of Italian state industrial holding IRI no longer makes any sense given the government's privatisation programme, Italian Labour Minister Tiziano Treu said on Thursday.
Treu, talking to reporters at a meeting here, said that, because privatisations were going ahead at all costs, "the shape which IRI has today no longer makes any sense."
IRI, whose full name is Istituto per la Ricostruzione Industriale, holds a shareholders meeting on Friday and Italian media have speculated the industrial mammoth is due for a shake-up.
The government is in the process of privatising IRI's assets, with motorway manager Autostrade and airport manager Aeroporti di Roma just two sectors on the sale list for this year.
Its stake in telecoms giant Stet, which is due to be privatised in October, was transferred to the Treasury at the end of last year to help reduce IRI's debt.
Newspapers have speculated that Treasury Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi, whose ministry is a major IRI shareholder, wants to change IRI's brief.
